vague_description: A florist needs to determine the optimal number of small and large bouquets to transport under specific constraints to maximize flower delivery.
detailed_description: A florist transports his flowers to stores in small bouquets and large bouquets. A small bouquet has \param{SmallBouquetSize} flowers while a large bouquet has \param{LargeBouquetSize} flowers. The florist can transport at most \param{MaxSmallBouquets} small bouquets and \param{MaxLargeBouquets} large bouquets. In total, he can transport at most \param{MaxTotalBouquets} bouquets and he must transport at least \param{MinLargeBouquets} large bouquets. Since small bouquets are more popular, he must transport at least \param{MinSmallLargeRatio} times as many small bouquets as large bouquets. How many of each bouquet should he transport to maximize the total number of flowers that reach the stores?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of flowers transported to the stores
target_constraints: Number of small bouquets is non-negative
Number of large bouquets is non-negative
At most MaxSmallBouquets small bouquets can be transported
At most MaxLargeBouquets large bouquets can be transported
A total of at most MaxTotalBouquets bouquets can be transported
At least MinLargeBouquets large bouquets must be transported
The number of small bouquets must be at least MinSmallLargeRatio times the number of large bouquets
target_parameters: Number of flowers in a small bouquet
Number of flowers in a large bouquet
Maximum number of small bouquets that can be transported
Maximum number of large bouquets that can be transported
Total maximum number of bouquets that can be transported
Minimum number of large bouquets that must be transported
Minimum ratio of small bouquets to large bouquets
